cmt:
Horrible customer services. Lying to customers.
At 13:56 April 25th I called 028-62636688 to book a table for 2 at 19:00. Due to Covid-19 I specifically asked the staff who handled the call whether the restaurant has re-opened and I was positively confirmed. I told him that I would use my Marriott card and I wanted a table near windows reserved. When I arrived at 19:00 the restaurant was closed and the whole 9th floor was completely dark. What the actual*** Spoke to the receptionist on ground floor about the incident and they called some operators or whatever and they told me that there was no booking at Bamboo Chic for the night. So now I'm a liar? Such a great customer service for a 5* hotel!!!

store_name: The LOG Restaurant
cmt:
Worst Experience Ever!
Went here for a birthday, the experience given is 1-star because I can't give it zero stars for a "supposedly" 5-star restaurant.

Why? Let me list the issues:

1. We booked a reservation, but the table provided didn't have proper air-conditioning (AC). They used one of those crappy portal AC units trying to cool down the clients.

2. We have been to several 5-star buffets throughout Saigon and never had a issue with being "bloated" while we had only had 1-2 plates a person. I suspect the restaurant adds a ton of baking soda into the food. Baking soda acts as a bloating agent in the human body causing the sensation of being "full". This is quite disgraceful because the bloating effect lasts for two days straight.

3. Pricing is set at 1.8 million dong per person, which is more expensive than the buffet in Nikko Hotel and many other buffets in Saigon. For the price, the food was not worth the money.

Overall experience: I would NEVER go here again and would NOT recommend this place to anyone else. Choose another 5-stars restaurant and not this imposter of a restaurant.

Save yourself the trouble and money!

cmt:
Háº£i Sáº£n Ngá»c SÆ°Æ¡ng - Nguyá»…n ÄÃ¬nh Chiá»ƒu
When I receive somebody from Japan, this place is one of my choice. They always serve with fresh and good food and atmosphere. One of their signature menue, fish rice paper roll, was good as always and prawn cooked with coconut juice, just about right sweetness with cooked texture. Don't forget to order scallop grilled with white sauce, their Sauce Bechamel is very very tasty!! This time, I learned to sprinkle rice cracker on hotpot and it was tasty experince!! Well, there were 2 negative points this time,,,, Squid grilled with salt and chili, too hot this time and crab stir fried with vermicelli was not quite good as always,,, crab flavor was not strong enough,,,. Overall, I still well recommend this place. (I hope their recent financial situation won't affect to their food they serve..)

store_name: Morico - Contemporary Japanese Lifestyle - LÃª Lá»£i
cmt:
Cozy place to hang out with friends, not very nice cakes
Very first time visiting Morico, we chose to go to the one in***street. Itâ€™s been hidden due to the construction is in progress so you should pay a little bit more attention finding it. 
- About the restaurant: not very big but nice deco and cozy, good place to chat with friends. However, there are loads of mosquitoes come â€œtesting your bloodâ€ at around 5pm onward which is so annoying us. We sat near the entrance, didnâ€™t feel the air con really eventhough the staffs said that the air con has been lowered to the lowest temp > minus points.
- About the food: we ordered tea and it was super nice, hot water is refilled. I order a chocolate cake as in the pic but was quite disapointed as the cake was very dry outside, not as soft as we normally have compared to other dessert restaurants, my friend ordered hokkaido crepes and it was so bad, we only tried 2 little bites then stop.
- About the staffs: superb!!! They are all welcoming and helpful > the only point makes me feel pleased
Anyway, the price is affordable and still a good place to hang out with friends generally. I might come back but not the one in*** will try another one to see if there are differences.

store_name: Opera Buffet - Park Hyatt Saigon
cmt:
Italian food from Italy but in Vietnam
Came here for dinner with some friends. We were told that this place tasted like italian food from italy rather than north american italian food and boy did it live up to our expectations. The appetizers of antipasto was amazing. The fresh bread, olive oil and balsalmic vinegrette was just how i remembered eating it in Florence. My husband had the wagu beef steak and they cooked it perfectly the way he likes it (chicago blue rare) and i had the lamb popsicles for dinner (again cooked perfectly to medium well). We shared the spaghetti with clams and it was so yummy! 

We had chocolate cake and tiramisu for dessert which again was good. 

Overall, food was amazing, beautiful restaurant, friendly staff but you are paying north american prices for food. Would recommend coming here for special occasions or if youre in the mood to splurge on dinner.

store_name: Parkview Buffet - New World Saigon Hotel
cmt:
Disappointing
The food was so limited and the service was very average for a 5-star hotel restaurant. Some of the staff was very friendly but others were just so cold towards us. 

Water and soft drinks aren't included in the buffet price so you have to order from the menu and pay additional costs. I only occasionally come to HCMC and rarely go to buffets here so I'm not sure if that's common among buffets. Though where I live, free-flow water and soft drinks are usually included. 

We ordered a steak from the kitchen and the beef was amazing but unfortunately it was too salty so it was quite difficult to finish all of it. 

The most disappointing was the butter razor clams we ordered from the kitchen as well because it turned out to be cooked with margarine instead of butter... My parents and I couldn't eat that at all because the margarine was so strong. 

Overall, I would just say we were all so disappointed as it didn't turn out as we'd expected especially coming from such a renowned hotel in HCMC. I'm not sure if it's because of the lack of customers that's led the quality to go so low or it was just an unlucky night for us. There is definitely a good concept of food there but it was all so disconnected and unbalanced.

store_name: Parkview Buffet - New World Saigon Hotel
cmt:
Decent lunch buffet menu
First time having lunch here. I do like to the open space view with high ceiling, semi fine dinning, and simple. The food selection wise, it is divided into stations, one is westernized food such as pizza, pastah, roasted pork, steak, etc... Second is Vietnamese food, such as pho, banh xeo, banh khot, etc....Third, cheese station for the cheese lovers. And so on, they do have sushi too btw, the fishs are fresh, I ate the salmond sashimin and it was good. 

Reason I said it was decent because the selection was great but some dish didnt meet the expectation in flavoring. We all know that at a buffet, you will always expect some unsatisfying dish and some are just great. So for this buffet here, I cant complaint haha. I did like the pastah, the veggies, the roasted pork, the pizza, the dessert because it was fruite lol, and the salmond.
